item.title: Pussycat A Go Go Las Vegas: A Wild Ride on the Strip's Shifting Sands
item.description:
The Dawn of a New Vegas Vibe

The 1960s were a period of immense cultural change, and Las Vegas, traditionally the domain of Frank Sinatra and the Rat Pack’s sophisticated glamour, was not immune. While the city’s iconic supper clubs continued to thrive, a new generation was hungry for something…different. Enter Pussycat A Go Go, which opened its doors in 1964, and immediately carved out a unique, and decidedly edgier, space on the Las Vegas Strip. Its location, now part of the sprawling Wynn Resort, once pulsed with a reckless, youthful energy that was a stark contrast to the surrounding elegance.
